job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bradenton, FL
pros: Love the Patients. Sacred Work.
cons: Vertical Management Hierarchy with a "dufus" MD saying yes to everything just to get the patient admitted. Very task oriented vs. patient and family centered care. They are trying to survive a labor crisis like everyone else in long-term care. Will exploit full-time employees vs. seasonal prn nurses. The later will stay on making +$50 per hour for 8+months and the full time RN will have to orient and train them. At the same time, you will make $27 per hour as salary with the same census and caseload. Prn or contract is the only way to go.

review_title: I used to really love my job here until ....
job_title: CNA in Sarasota, FL
pros: End of life care is very rewarding in itself. My team/co-workers were awesome! Love the philosophy behind hospice.
cons: There is little to no growth potential with this company. Employee morale is extremely low. CEO is full of himself, and full of empty promises to his employees. Open door policy is literally a joke. Serious safety issues for staff and patients are a daily reality. Poor leadership from management. This company does not value its employees, actions speak louder than words. CEO does not answer direct hard-hitting questions, he sweeps everything under the rug. The individuals that really love their job, and do excellent work, are seldom, if ever recognized. It is very sad how this company has changed from being the BEST company to ever work for, to if another hospice were to come here I'd leave in a heartbeat!

job_title: Leadership in Sarasota, FL
pros: Truly fulfills its mission and serves the community well. One of the best and biggest employers in the area. Staff really cares about the people served. Leadership always took the high road when I worked there. Succession planning and strategic planning were well done.
cons: Grew really fast and needed time to catch up with some internal systems and processes. Hire more people from outside the core industry to bring some best practices that may be valuable.

review_title: Forced to post review to continue with Glassdoor. Poor pay, long hours. Good mission focus
job_title: RN Case Manager in Sarasota, FL
pros: Excellent mission values. Good benefits!
cons: Upper management not knowledgeable about and unreasonable about field staff duties/expectations. Company does not support employees in any conflict resolutions. Medicare fraud found in trying to keep Certificate of Need. Low pay scale compared to other local RN positions.

review_title: Like watching the titanic sink, so sad!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Patuxent River, MD
pros: The staff that do the difficult hospice work with integrity and compassion.
cons: Upper Level Management (CEO, & EVP's & most VP's) are Vain & Ungrateful to the staff. Egos are out-of-control: In public they steal the limelight and take the credit for the successes of the amazing hospice clinical team actually doing the end-of-life care with compassion. Heartless: They have no idea, or do they appear to care, that hospice is a people business and compassion should not be optional.  Blame & Bullying: finger pointing and scapegoats are selected when things go wrong, even when it is clearly the fault of the poor leadership. Arrogant: prevent collaboration that might reveal their ignorance, belittles any true expertise in staff that advocate for the patient & families. Divide and Conquer (including Human Resources) pit individuals and teams against one another, causing low morale and resentment of co-workers. Hostile & Judgmental: publicly makes negative remarks concerning former employees, and also state "you don't like it work somewhere else", generating fear among the staff of potential smear campaign or possible job loss. Only hospice in area, if you love working in the hospice field you have no where else to work. Morally Bankrupt: non-profit hospice but now run, like a for-profit "where you wash your hands of ethics" in order to increase your power, salaries & bonuses, worst of all their own self-interest. Company perks only for upper level management (catered meetings, VIP events). Hello!!!  Donations are only because of the staff that care for patients, but they don't do anything for the staff to improve morale or reward them for this difficult work. Staff potlucks:( if they can be fit in during the hectic work day. Donations used for fancy buildings instead of patient care products that are a tiny bit more expensive but can improve patient comfort and give staff better tools. Oppressive culture of Fear, many good people are quitting hospice to get off this sinking ship, so sad that a few selfish people are destroying this once great company.
